text:
Sonia turned at the corner, unaware of the man behind her. 

“Bah!” he muttered, following her up the stairs. 

At the third storey, she rang the bell at No. 9. 

“Kapernaumov, Tailor,” read the chalk inscription. 

“Bah!” he repeated, ringing No. 8. 

“You lodge at Kapernaumov’s,” he laughed. 

Sonia looked at him, surprised. 

“I’m at Madame Resslich’s,” he said. “How odd!” 

She felt uneasy as the door opened. 

Razumihin was excited on his way to Porfiry. 

“That’s capital, brother!” he exclaimed. 

“What are you glad about?” Raskolnikov thought. 

He recalled visiting the old woman days before her death.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia encounters a stranger who reveals they are neighbors, leading her to feel uneasy.
